      Constructors in answer that throw WarehouseException 
      Constructor and Description

      Construct a warehouse's ledger with the supplied initial stock level and cash reserve.

      Define the transactions you can perform while managing a warehouse of items awaiting retail sale.

    • Uses of WarehouseException in question

      Methods in question that throw WarehouseException 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Ledger.buyItems(java.lang.Integer required)
      Updates the ledger to reflect the purchase of the required number of items at their fixed wholesale cost (provided when the ledger was constructed).
      java.lang.Integer Ledger.cashAvailable(java.lang.Integer day)
      Returns the cash reserve at the end of the given day, or the current cash reserve if parameter day is today.
      java.lang.Integer Ledger.inStock(java.lang.Integer day)
      Returns the number of items in stock at the end of the given day, or the current number in stock if parameter day is today.
      void Transactions.restockAndSellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
      Complete a day's transactions by (1) restocking the warehouse to capacity, (2) selling the ordered number of items, and (3) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.
      boolean Ledger.sellItems(java.lang.Integer requested)
      Updates the ledger to reflect the sale of the requested number of items at their fixed retail price (provided when the ledger was constructed).
      void Transactions.sellStock(java.lang.Integer todaysOrder)
      Complete a day's transactions by (1) selling the ordered number of items, and (2) by turning the page in the ledger, in that order.
